condition.description:
Your skin changes as you age. You might notice wrinkles, age spots and dryness. Your skin also becomes thinner and loses fat, making it less plump and smooth. It might take longer to heal, too.

Sunlight is a major cause of skin aging. You can protect yourself by staying out of the sun when it is strongest, using sunscreen with an SPF of 15 or higher, wearing protective clothing, and avoiding sunlamps and tanning beds. Cigarette smoking also contributes to wrinkles. The wrinkling increases with the amount of cigarettes and number of years a person has smoked.

Many products claim to revitalize aging skin or reduce wrinkles, but the Food and Drug Administration has approved only a few for sun-damaged or aging skin. Various treatments soothe dry skin and reduce the appearance of age spots.

NIH: National Institute on Aging
condition.name: Wrinkles

carousel_items: Works best as part of a complete skin care program (including SPF) to protect your skin from sun damage.
Renova doesn't permanently erase or improve significant skin changes such as deep wrinkles.
Apply a very small amount (pea-size) on entire face once a day at bedtime.
You'll need to use Renova regularly for at least 3 to 4 months before you see improvement. Once you stop, the improvement may slowly disappear.
Renova wasn't studied in people with skin cancer or serious damage from the sun (actinic keratosis) so it's not known if this would benefit.
Not safe to use during pregnancy. Even though Renova is applied to the skin, a small amount is absorbed and harmful to your unborn baby.
Some medicines you take by mouth can make you more sensitive to sunlight and combine with effects of Renova. Check with your doctor or pharmacist before you take any new medicines.

basics.benefits_moa: Renova is a vitamin A derivative. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to make skin cells renew faster and better.
basics.bottom_line: Renova isn't a cure for fine lines and wrinkles, but it's clinically proven to improve them.
downsides: It may take up to 6 months to see the full benefit for facial wrinkles.
Not a good choice for women who want to become or are pregnant
Can change the color and texture of your skin if used long-term.
You need to be careful about avoiding any sunlight or artificial tanning while using it.
It doesn't work for deep wrinkles.

downsides_processed.orig: It may take up to 6 months to see the full benefit for facial wrinkles.
Not a good choice for women who want to become or are pregnant
Can change the color and texture of your skin if used long-term.
You need to be careful about avoiding any sunlight or artificial tanning while using it.
It doesn't work for deep wrinkles.

upsides: You only need to apply it once a day, usually in the evening.
Most people who reported having skin irritation said that it was mild.
Part of a complete program to help you take better care of your skin.

Part of a complete program to help you take better care of your skin.

userStories.tip: You can apply your nightcream over it once it dries, and this helps the dryness
You need to just push through the first two weeks of dry skin--it will improve.

I was prescribed it for night-time use, and I often had dry facial skin by the morning. Moisturizer was important for me. It was very important for me to keep it away from the skin around my eyes because that area easily got pink and dry.
Wait at least 20 minutes after washing your face to apply. Will help reduce irritation and peeling.
Burns skin, causes cracking at corner of lips.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: This dried out my skin and caused other problems, I found a 10% benzoyl peroxide solution over the counter that solved my acne problem day of.

drugs.name: Renova

carousel_items_processed.orig: Works best as part of a complete skin care program (including SPF) to protect your skin from sun damage.
Renova doesn't permanently erase or improve significant skin changes such as deep wrinkles.
Apply a very small amount (pea-size) on entire face once a day at bedtime.
You'll need to use Renova regularly for at least 3 to 4 months before you see improvement. Once you stop, the improvement may slowly disappear.
Renova wasn't studied in people with skin cancer or serious damage from the sun (actinic keratosis) so it's not known if this would benefit.
Not safe to use during pregnancy. Even though Renova is applied to the skin, a small amount is absorbed and harmful to your unborn baby.
Some medicines you take by mouth can make you more sensitive to sunlight and combine with effects of Renova. Check with your doctor or pharmacist before you take any new medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Skin irritation
risks_warnings.description: Renova may cause skin redness, burning, peeling or swelling. Be careful using Renova if you have a condition called eczema, because your skin may already be red, itchy and irritated.
risk_factors: Using other medicines or products that irritate the skin

description_processed.orig: Renova may cause skin redness, burning, peeling or swelling. Be careful using Renova if you have a condition called eczema, because your skin may already be red, itchy and irritated.

risks_warnings.title: Sun sensitivity
risks_warnings.description: Your skin is more likely to sunburn while you're using Renova. Avoid tanning outdoors and tanning beds. Apply sunblock to your skin or wear protective clothing on treated areas if you have to be out in the sun.

description_processed.orig: Your skin is more likely to sunburn while you're using Renova. Avoid tanning outdoors and tanning beds. Apply sunblock to your skin or wear protective clothing on treated areas if you have to be out in the sun.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Another brand with the same active medicine as Renova  contains products made from fish. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any allergies to fish or fish products before using Renova or similar brands.
risk_factors: Allergy to fish or fish products

description_processed.orig: Another brand with the same active medicine as Renova  contains products made from fish. Make sure you tell your doctor if you have any allergies to fish or fish products before using Renova or similar brands.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Not a good choice if you are planning to become or are pregnant. Using Renova on your skin can harm your unborn baby. Talk to your doctor about a better alternative to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Not a good choice if you are planning to become or are pregnant. Using Renova on your skin can harm your unborn baby. Talk to your doctor about a better alternative to treat your condition.
